meanings.sent1: The rebels were successful in dethroning the king.
meanings.sent2: The people celebrated the dethroning of the oppressive ruler.
meanings.sent3: The dethroning of the queen led to a peaceful transition of power.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the knight strategically dethroned the opponent's king.
meanings.sent5: The act of dethroning symbolized the end of an era for the kingdom.

meanings.definition: Remove from a position of authority or dominance.
meanings.sent1: The board members decided to dethrone the CEO due to misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The team's hard work and dedication led to the dethroning of the reigning champions.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully imagined dethroning the dog as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The new technology quickly dethroned the old methods of communication.
meanings.sent5: The sudden market shift resulted in the dethroning of the leading company.
